contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} '''Urianus''' was a legendary king of the [[Britons (historic)|Britons]] as accounted by [[Geoffrey of Monmouth]]. He was the son of King [[Andragius]] and was succeeded by [[Eliud]]. Geoffrey may possibly have based the character on that of [[Urien Rheged]] (6th century), although there is no resemblance between them. ==References== {{s-start}} {{s-reg | leg }} {{s-bef | before = [[Andragius]] }} {{s-ttl | title = [[List of legendary kings of Britain|King of Britain]] }} {{s-aft | after = [[Eliud]] }} {{s-end}} <!-- NB not a stub - this is absolutely ALL there is to say about Geoffrey's one-line fictitious character --> [[Category:British traditional history]] [[Category:2nd-century BC legendary rulers]]
